page.title: 09Dockyard Diving Unit Part 2
page.content: Grytvicken Harbour in South Georgia in 24 metres of water and was fully primed with torpedoes.The divers had to raise the submarine and tow it 50 miles out of harm's way, then sink it. They used various types of equipment on the Santa Fe:- cutting discs to make holes in the submarine and also welding patches over the shell holes.Working in extremely cold conditions all the divers had to wear special diving suits.The decrompression chamber is used to help divers suffering from the 'Bends' or decrompression sickness the most common form of which is a bubble of nitrogen which hasn't dispersed and has lodged somewhere in the body.By the use of specific tables the bubble can be dispersed.The chamber is sometimes used to help people suffering from arthritis.
